thread.title: ABC apologizes for mixing up video of Indian actresses
thread.title_full: ABC apologizes for mixing up video of Indian actresses

title: ABC apologizes for mixing up video of Indian actresses
text:
Updated: 11:45 a.m.   | Posted: 11:45 a.m.   ABC apologizes for mixing up video of Indian actresses Related View Larger FILE - In this Aug. 4, 2015 file photo, Priyanka Chopra poses at the Disney ABC Television Group party during the 2015 Television Critics Association Summer Press Tour in Beverly Hills, Calif. ABC’s “Nightline” is apologizing for confusing new network star Priyanka Chopra with another Indian actress. The news magazine aired a feature earlier this week about Chopra, the star of ABC’s new drama “Quantico.” A video shot supposedly showing Chopra in the Miss World pageant was actually Yukta Mookhey, who won the crown in 1999. Chopra was the 2000 Miss World winner. (Photo by Chris Pizzello/Invision/AP, File) Sponsored Links LOS ANGELES — 
ABC's "Nightline" is apologizing for confusing new network star Priyanka Chopra with another Indian actress. 
The news magazine aired a feature earlier this week about Chopra, the star of ABC's new drama "Quantico." A video shot supposedly showing Chopra in the Miss World pageant was included. 
But the video was of Yukta Mookhey, who won the crown in 1999. Chopra was the 2000 Miss World winner. 
The error was noted online by viewers, and ABC responded with an apology and posted a corrected version of the "Nightline" story online. 
Chopra, a Bollywood star who plays an FBI recruit in "Quantico," responded to the mix-up on Twitter by posting "LOL" and linking to another post that read, "Uh oh, @Nightline!" Copyright The Associated Press Sign up for our KIRO-TV Daily Headlines Newsletter Sign Up
